DOC.brief_summary: The purpose dual-site quasi-experimental pilot study evaluate implementation educational intervention pair environmental assessment address accessibility barrier associate improvement staff knowledge skill , adherence national guideline use ( evaluation knowledge transfer framework ) emergency department ( ED ) setting .
DOC.brief_title: Capnography At Bedside : Leading Educational Efforts
DOC.detailed_description: The objective study develop multi-faceted implementation program ( referred Capnography At Bedside : Leading Emergency Education ( CapABLE Trial ) ) increase use capnography two critical event emergency department , intubation CPR , good detection endotracheal intubation , endotracheal tube dislodgement , quality CPR . The specific aim propose study examine : 1. effect comprehensive theory-based educational intervention staff knowledge skill relate capnography ( outcome measure ) . 2. effect multi-faceted implementation program adherence national guideline regard use capnography critical event emergency department ( process measure ) . 3. sustainability effect implementation program adherence , knowledge skill ( outcome process measure ) . The design method study base knowledge transfer framework , dictate identification message , target audience , messenger , process communication , evaluation .
DOC.criteria: Emergency department ( ED ) staff Staff include registered nurse , respiratory therapist , technical associate , physician , physician 's assistant advance practice nurse practitioner fulfill majority clinical duty ED . Staff assign work unit , work ED casual per diem status exclude .
